page.title: 02NORTON AREA - BACKGROUND.
page.content: There is no mention of the village of Norton in the original Domesday Book in either text or map form although by this time the Normans had certainly begun construction of the church here. On a roadless map of Worcestershire which John Speede published in 1601, Norton appears halfway between Battenhall Park and Wadborough Park. Norton-juxta-Kempsey (as it is called), is due north of Kempsey Common where people believe an early settlement of Anglo-Saxons was. This could be true as the Anglo 'north tun' derives the word Norton over time. Apart from the years when the Barracks artificially boosted the population, Norton has always been a small village with a large interest in agriculture although this itself is now changing.
